item.title: The Basics
item.description: What is Socratica? § Written by Anson Yu and Joss Murphy TLDR: We assemble kind, nerdy, and ambitious young people that are dedicated to consistently creating.

item.title: Credits
item.description: Contributors § Editors Anson Yu Jake Rudolph Tech & design Aman Mathur Jacky Zhao Hudzah Branding Aileen Luo Brayden Petersen Writers Anson Yu Scott Langille Mathurah Ravigulan Rishi Kothari Joss Murphy Hudzah Aditya Sharma Jaclyn Chan Jacky Zhao Anthea Tawiah Jake Rudolph Maya Lekhi Aileen Luo Aava Sapkota kai Aadil Pickle (lol) Brayden Petersen Ananya Anupam Jonathan Xu Binalpreet Kalra Supporters § This work, and Socratica as a whole, is supported by our friends at Eigenspace and generous individual donors.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: When to start a node § Written by Jacky Zhao and Jake Rudolph In short, you should considering starting a node if: You want this for yourself You have faith that there are good people around you You are willing to put in the work to cultivate this Note that none of those bullets include specific personality traits.

item.title: Growing People
item.description: How to organize spaces that feel awesome § Written by Jaclyn Chan and Jacky Zhao Picture yourself entering a Socratica session. What do you feel? What do you want the participants to feel? How do hosts ensure that Socratica remains inclusive, beginner-friendly, and a good time? Balance is key – people want to be in spaces where they feel like they can bring their full self.

item.title: Maintenance
item.description: How to handoff to new hosts § Written by Ananya Anupam and Jake Rudolph Beyond fostering spaces for amazing work, longevity should be one of the primary areas of focus for nodes.

item.title: Superboosting Ideas
item.description: Types of Ideas § Written by Jake Rudolph A core pillar of building a community for people to see the best version of their ideas is to understand ideas, how they progress over time, and how you can support your people at each stage of their idea.
